intro: Ericoides seriphiifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mountain heath, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes evergreens and shrubs adapted to acidic soils. The plant features small, leathery leaves that are typically narrow and pointed, aiding in water conservation. Its flowers are usually pink or white, appearing in clusters and blooming in late spring to early summer. Ericoides seriphiifolium thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in pine or fir forests.
